meanings.definition: To cross a body of water by wading.
meanings.sent1: The explorer forded the shallow river to reach the other side.
meanings.sent2: We will need to ford the stream to continue our hike.
meanings.sent3: The children forded the small creek, pretending it was a dangerous adventure.
meanings.sent4: She forded the river of emotions, trying to stay strong.
meanings.sent5: Fording the river, he felt the cool water rushing around his legs.

meanings.definition: Having crossed a body of water by wading.
meanings.sent1: The fordeds explorers set up camp on the opposite bank.
meanings.sent2: The fordeds group shared stories of their watery journey.
meanings.sent3: The fordeds travelers dried their clothes by the fire.
meanings.sent4: The fordeds adventurers were proud of their accomplishment.
meanings.sent5: Their fordeds clothes bore witness to their aquatic feat.
